questions.question: If $f(x) = 4x^2 + 3x - 5$, find the value(s) of $x$ if $f(x) = 71$.
questions.explanation: Set $4x^2 + 3x - 5 = 71$ â†’ $4x^2 + 3x - 76 = 0$. Use quadratic formula: $x = \frac{-3 \pm \sqrt{9 + 1216}}{8} = \frac{-3 \pm 35}{8}$. Solutions: $x = 4$ or $x = -\frac{19}{4}$.

questions.question: Simplify: $(4x^3 - 3x^2 + 7) - 3(x^3 - 5x^2 - 2)$.
questions.explanation: Distribute: $-3(x^3 - 5x^2 - 2) = -3x^3 + 15x^2 + 6$. Combine with first polynomial: $(4x^3 - 3x^2 + 7) + (-3x^3 + 15x^2 + 6) = x^3 + 12x^2 + 13$.
